JUDGES: André Potocki;Angelika Nußberger;Ann Power-Forde;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in the town of ORG , GPE . They were represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in the same town .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The first applicant is a Second World War veteran . Since DATE he has been on a housing waiting list of ORG as he required an improvement of his housing conditions . The first applicant requested to be provided with an apartment for his family of CARDINAL ( the first applicant , his wife and his son , who is the second applicant ) . The first applicant ’s position on the main waiting list was no . DATE and no . CARDINAL on the special waiting list for Second World War veterans .

In DATE the first applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG against ORG and ORG asking to be provided with an apartment in accordance with LAW GPE . On DATE the court allowed the first applicant ’s claim and ordered the local authorities to provide him with an apartment .
On DATE ORG of GPE ( the ARC ) quashed this decision and remitted the case for fresh consideration .
In DATE the applicants lodged an amended claim .

On DATE the ORG rejected the ORG claim . The court found that in DATE the first applicant ’s position on the main waiting list was no . DATE and no . CARDINAL on the special waiting list for Second World War veterans . According to LAW , citizens who are registered as needing improved living conditions are provided with housing in order of precedence . The applicant could thus not be provided with an apartment out of turn and before those persons who were above him on the list . Moreover , the local authorities did not have financing for housing construction from ORG .
On DATE ORG of the ARC upheld this decision .
On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed the ORG appeal on points of law .
Relevant provisions of LAW in force at the material time read as follows :

“ ORG who need improvement of housing conditions shall have right to be provided with housing for use in buildings of ORG or municipal residential stock according to procedures envisaged [ by law ] ... ”
“ ORG who are registered as needing improved living conditions are provided with housing in order of precedence .
The order of precedence for being provided with housing is set out in ... this LAW and other legal acts ...
From those citizens registered as needing improved housing , lists of those who have a priority right for housing are formed .
The order of precedence depends on the date of registration ( on the list of those , who have a priority right for housing ) .
“ Special priority for housing is given to :

- Second World War veterans [ ... ] within DATE from the date of their registration on the list for priority housing ... Second World War disabled persons [ ... ] shall receive housing prior to all other persons eligible for priority housing ”
“ Executive bodies of [ ... ] town councils have :
b ) delegated powers :
CARDINAL ) to provide , in accordance with the law , housing which is free or accessible in price , to citizens who are in need of social protection ... ”
